response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (22 years)", "high", "Being a young adult is associated with a higher risk of recidivism due to life stage factors and less stability."],
    ["Race (White)", "low", "Research often indicates that White individuals have a somewhat lower observed risk compared to some other racial groups in recidivism studies."],
    ["Criminal History (1 arrest, no conviction)", "medium", "Even a single arrest can be a moderate risk indicator, though the lack of convictions tempers the risk."],
    ["Physical Attributes (Height and Weight)", "low", "Physical attributes such as height and weight are not predictive of recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital Status and Living Arrangements (Never married, not living alone)", "low", "Not living alone serves as a protective factor, and being unmarried in young adulthood is common and not strongly predictive."],
    ["Educational Attainment (High school diploma, not in college)", "medium", "While a high school diploma is the baseline, lack of further education can limit opportunities, placing moderate risk."],
    ["Employment History (1 job held during the year)", "medium", "Limited employment history can signal stability issues, contributing to a moderate risk assessment."],
    ["Substance Use (No drug use in past four years)", "low", "Absence of recent drug use is a strong protective factor regarding recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health (No recent depression)", "low", "Not experiencing depression is a protective factor, reducing likelihood of recidivism."],
    ["Early Family Environment (Household size of 4 in youth)", "low", "A typical household size in youth does not imply additional risk."],
    ["Religious Belief (Considers God involved in personal outcomes)", "low", "Religious or spiritual beliefs can provide social support and personal structure that is protective."]
  ],
  "prediction": "NO",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: Age (22 years)
high
Being a young adult is associated with a higher risk of recidivism due to life stage factors and less stability.
Race (White)
low
Research often indicates that White individuals have a somewhat lower observed risk compared to some other racial groups in recidivism studies.
Criminal History (1 arrest, no conviction)
medium
Even a single arrest can be a moderate risk indicator, though the lack of convictions tempers the risk.
Physical Attributes (Height and Weight)
low
Physical attributes such as height and weight are not predictive of recidivism risk.
Marital Status and Living Arrangements (Never married, not living alone)
low
Not living alone serves as a protective factor, and being unmarried in young adulthood is common and not strongly predictive.

medium

medium

low

low
Not experiencing depression is a protective factor, reducing likelihood of recidivism.
Early Family Environment (Household size of 4 in youth)
low
A typical household size in youth does not imply additional risk.
Religious Belief (Considers God involved in personal outcomes)
low
Religious or spiritual beliefs can provide social support and personal structure that is protective.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 9 inches and weighs 165 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived in a household of size 4. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
